7/22/2018

LayoutNode.Content: I can't begin to describe how happy I am with my personal training.Justin O'Neil has it all - Star Trek references, unicorn tattoos andan uncanny ability to make me laugh the whole time he's helpingme push myself to the limit. Seriously, I laughed the whole time.This hunk has made me lose almost two inches off my waist, and Igained a true friend in the process. I truly enjoyed every moment Ispent in the gym. He also outlined a diet and supplement plan forme, and gave me the best massages when my shins and calveswere ready to quit so I could keep pushing. I've done personaltraining before, and this is by far the best experience I've everhad. Every time I got down on myself he encouraged me to be thebest I can be -- therapy, friendship and training all in one. I wish Icould give more than five stars. I'm now more than three months into my fitness journey andfeeling on top of the world. If you want to learn your limits and thenlearn to overcome them, hire Justin to whip your cute butt intoshape. THANK YOU, Sugar, for helping me get des cookies.You've changed my life!!

If you want to learn your limits and thenlearn to overcome them, hire Justin to whip your cute butt intoshape. THANK YOU, Sugar, for helping me get des cookies.You've changed my life!!

LayoutNode.Content: 7/12/2018 I've been a member of Fitness SF for 3 years...Equinoix and 24hour Fitness prior to that. I spend equal times at 4 differentlocations including the one in Castro. Each gym has it strongpoints and it keeps it interesting to change it up a bit. I have takenswimming lessons at the Filmore location with Austin, and couldnot have been happier with the experience. The gyms are clean, great floorpans and well equipped with thestate of the art equipment. I've only encountered pleasant staff atthe door and the trainers seem as knowledgeable and competentas the ones at Equinox. I'm up for renewal this month and look forward to signing on foranother year. I've heard the rates have increased slightly fromwhen I joined, but what hasn't gotten more expensive in SF in thelast few years.

LayoutNode.Content: Overpriced, Oversexualized, Overcrowded, Dirty & Rude Patronsand Staff! I have been a long time Gold's then Fitness SF member (over 10years). Recently they raised their dues again from $39.95 to$49.95. It now costs way more than it is worth and here's why: - Overpriced - you can join boutique gyms that are cleaner, lesscrowded with friendlier patrons and staff for the same or less - Oversexualized - they used to have a steamroom which theyfinally closed - many time when I was in the open shower area youwould look over and see an orgy going on in the steamroom, nowthat it is closed, I have had many guys oogle me while showeringwith hardons and I have witnessed many times guys jerking eachother off in the shower but have never seen management or staffmake any attempt to monitor or stop this activity - Overcrowded - the locker room is super small and crowded, itseems that no matter where you pick a locker you will end uphaving to move, be elbow to elbow with other patrons and it's justclaustrophobically small, not only are the locker rooms packed butthe gym floor is too and many of the patrons and trainers work outon multiple machines at once, tying up machines that sit empty inbetween them using other equipment, very few have the etiquetteto let people work in with them either, if someone is using a pieceof equipment forget trying to work in. Also, recently they packedmore equipment and machines onto the 2nd floor in particular andit is a tripping hazard to navigate between the machines andequipment that is so closely packed together without enough roomto walk in between. - Dirty - I belonged to the Gold's in Oakland before I moved to SFand joined the Gold's (now Fitness SF) in the Castro. The gym inOakland was immaculate and people obeyed gym etiquette, butnot here! Most people leave their sweat and stink on equipmentand make no attempt to clean up after themselves, many don'teven use a towel. They have a cleaning staff but they don't seemable to keep up with the cleaning and ironically I found theyusually start cleaning equipment around you when you're doingcardio so I have found it hard to breathe without inhaling thecleaning supply odors. - Rude Staff and Patrons - I was paying alot of money for personaltraining and my trainer told me someone complained that I was"grunting" when he was working me so hard I almost passed out. Ispoke to the manager and he compared my grunting to havingbad body odor. Also, many of the patrons are entitled and rude. Generally, I have found the front desk staff to be unfriendly andunhelpful.

LayoutNode.Content: I joined fitness SF when I first moved to SF 6 months ago, andsigned up for personal training as I had muscle imbalances Iwanted to fix and because I was in need of a life boost and thoughtmaybe this would help. Here I am 6 months later, stronger mentallyand physically. My trainer, Aaron, has been there for me when I'vehad emotionally hard days. I walk in feeling drained and I walk outfeeling like a stronger and happier person. We laughed the otherday as we realized my current self would kick the ass of my self 6months ago. Aaron is the best and I can't imagine my weekswithout training with him!
LayoutNode.SRC: I joined fitness SF when I first moved to SF 6 months ago, and signed up for personal training as I had muscle imbalances I wanted to fix and because I was in need of a life boost and thought maybe this would help. Here I am 6 months later, stronger mentally and physically. My trainer, Aaron, has been there for me when I've had emotionally hard days. I walk in feeling drained and I walk out feeling like a stronger and happier person. We laughed the other day as we realized my current self would kick the ass of my self 6 months ago. Aaron is the best and I can't imagine my weeks without training with him!

LayoutNode.Content: Do not believe comment below: I've completed many tines aboutmembers and trainers hogging equipment. Only once did Markactually look to talk to the person. When s trainer was involved,the manager - details below - criticized me rather than helpingtrainers learn to share. Overall, the gym is like a restaurant with a great view at a crushedbeach: it is convenient but the management indifferent at best andthe services mediocre. Alas the best of dim lit in the castro muchlike the mediocre restaurants - well frances is great food andservice but fitness sf more like a Dennys - in the Midwest. Pluses: Less costly than equinox; convenient if in Castro; freeparking (with membership); some decent cardio equipment; decentyoga classes (but not insulated from the clank of weights - muchbetter at Equinox, although equinox much more costly); showersnow have decent soap and shampoo; towel service, although kindof thin towels; Minuses: The trainers generally mediocre and don't pay attentionto clients (Ashlyn, whom I"ve been using, is something of anexception. She's decent at basic weight training and attentive butknows nothing about nutrition. When I mentioned consult on myheart, she just said she wouldn't train me, and didn't offer muchempathy at all.) Showers are communal, and people sometimes jerk off and almostalways ogle. Management unkind. I complained that people were not sharingequipment, and one trainer recently wanted to use two pieces ofequipment continuously for what turned out to be more than 20minutes. The manager asked to speak to me today. He asked howI was and ... No exaggeration: I said I just found out that I might have to haveopen heart surgery. He then told me, albeit after some talk, thatthe trainer thought I was too aggressive, and I should tone it down. I've also heard the manager banned a member because he washelping another member, and the manager thought that wasunauthorized personal training. I also belong at Equinox Sports Club LA, and they are the bestgym on earth. See my review of them.

LayoutNode.Content: �� �� In accordance with my values of always trying to acknowledgewhen someone has done something great and outstanding foranother person (and in this case for me), I'm writing yet anotherreview. I had a nagging injury that I just wasn't able to rehab onmy own, so I finally decided to train with Fitness Director, JoseBonilla. He was able to trouble shoot my weakness and muscularimbalances and prescribe the proper exercises to rectify them. Hedid this in a quick and very efficient manner and then we workedtogether until I was able to once again train on my own. Obviously Jose isn't a physical therapist but as far as I'mconcerned that's what I was doing and I'm extremely pleased withthe results and would definitely hire him again.

He was able to trouble shoot my weakness and muscularimbalances and prescribe the proper exercises to rectify them. Obviously Jose isn't a physical therapist but as far as I'mconcerned that's what I was doing and I'm extremely pleased withthe results and would definitely hire him again.

LayoutNode.Content: I like this gym and it fills all my basic needs, but it does getcrowded a lot. I absolutely hate the music here. Half the time I come its the samegoddamn songs by Katy Perry, Chainsmokers or Bruno Mars. It'sso damn loud.I really can't stand it. Really ruins my experience. Ifyou're like me and can't have a good workout while terrible musicis played loud, beware. And yes, I wear headphones at the gymand listen to my own music or podcasts the entire time I'm here. Ican still hear the terrible music over whatever I am trying to listento.

LayoutNode.Content: 24 check-ins

Really happy I joined this gym. They have a really wide variety ofequipment and machines - everything I need to do my strengthtraining regimen. They also have some great fitness classteachers (particularly love having access to the yoga and Zumbaclasses). The only thing is it gets really crowded weekdays afterwork hours (5:30 - 8) so you sometimes do have to wait. Butpeople are generally quite respectful and you can always tryasking to work in.
LayoutNode.SRC: Really happy I joined this gym. They have a really wide variety of equipment and machines - everything I need to do my strength training regimen. They also have some great fitness class teachers (particularly love having access to the yoga and Zumba classes). The only thing is it gets really crowded weekdays after work hours (5:30 - 8) so you sometimes do have to wait. But people are generally quite respectful and you can always try asking to work in.

LayoutNode.Content: 2/13/2018 Most terrible customer service. I moved away from SF, and email right away that I would like tocancel, and they responded that the account was cancelled (Jan5th). However, they charged for me for the month I cancelled andapparently my credit card had declined. I emailed them when I gotan automated email, and they didn't respond for a week, andreplied after a week that it was sent to collections.

LayoutNode.Content: 10/24/2017 Customer for many years. Moving out of town. Call Oct. 24 tocancel membership. "Oh, you have to pay for November becauseyou didn't cancel 15 days before November 1." **UPDATE, re response: Okay, you require a 15 day noticebecause...why? Because other gyms rip people off it's okay foryou to do it too, just less so? It's a lousy policy, period. I'm raisingmy rating because I am apparently now not being billed forNovember. Please explain how your policy makes any sense--don'tsay "We're not as bad as other places".
LayoutNode.SRC: 10/24/2017 Customer for many years. Moving out of town. Call Oct. 24 tocancel membership. Please explain how your policy makes any sense--don'tsay "We're not as bad as other places".

LayoutNode.Content: Please, please, please, please either up the air conditioning or getsome more fans upstairs. On warm days when the gym is packedit's literally too hot to train for long distance running in the cardioarea unless you get one of the two treadmills under the singularfan. I've had to stop running because I started to feel heatexhaustion (for real) coming on once or twice. I'll give you an additional review star if you add more fans.

LayoutNode.Content: Today was my last PT session with the Trainer Zach Taylor. I wasworking with Zach for the total of 24 sessions and I must I admitthat he is one of the best PT I ever had. Zach is knowledgeable,highly skilled and motivative trainer who can easily understandyour body needs to make it fit and well balanced. He helped me toimprove my posture and made my body more balanced andstabled. In about 1.5 months my muscles mass increased at 4.5Ibs and my body fat percentage decreased at 2.5%. I highlyrecommend to work with Zach.
LayoutNode.SRC: Today was my last PT session with the Trainer Zach Taylor. I was working with Zach for the total of 24 sessions and I must I admit that he is one of the best PT I ever had. Zach is knowledgeable, highly skilled and motivative trainer who can easily understand your body needs to make it fit and well balanced. He helped me to improve my posture and made my body more balanced and stabled. In about 1.5 months my muscles mass increased at 4.5 Ibs and my body fat percentage decreased at 2.5%. I highly recommend to work with Zach.

LayoutNode.Content: No suggestion box here. This establishment seems not care nomore since they sign up new customers till over crowded. Good forcursing place for gays The staffs are NOT friendly, right after signed you up. Themanagement from the to down are not friendly. Used to be a niceclean and friendly gym. Used to have a very nice clean lady who smile all the time, nowshe have to be stuck in laundry room to wash and fold towelsbecause they try to save a few bucks. She should be thereceptionist...seriously... sad sad sad

LayoutNode.Content: 5/6/2017 I am a long time member, but have come to completely and totallyHATE Castro Fitness SF. So MANY entitled jerks on their cellphones, hogging benches they are not even using, and themanagement does nothing about it. By not using the bench, Imean they have no intention of sitting down on it. They standbeside it doing an exercise and use the bench as their personalstorage area for their cell phone, towel, water bottle, etc. If you askto work in, they throw attitude as though this is their personal gym. I once a saw a guy knock over his own water bottle creating ahuge water puddle on the gym floor. He just walked away leaving itthere for other people to have to walk around or step over. It tooka different, more considerate member to go downstairs, get atowel, and clean it up. This has become standard operatingprocedure for this gym. This is a very crowded gym, and the claimed but unused benchesjust make it very difficult to get in a good workout at a reasonablepace. If you can, go to any gym other than this one.

This has become standard operatingprocedure for this gym.This is a very crowded gym, and the claimed but unused benchesjust make it very difficult to get in a good workout at a reasonablepace. If you can, go to any gym other than this one.

LayoutNode.Content: Great local gym in the Castro. The recently moved Tricio to the front desk. He's great and thefriendliest face that they have ever had welcoming patrons! I just wish the trainers would not eat their meals/snacks next to theworkout area (don't they have their own office/break room?). Ican't workout smelling reheated leftovers. Overall, a great place to workout.

LayoutNode.Content: 5/5/2017 I used to have a membership to Equinox - it was alright. I thenjoined Fitness SF - it was alright too. After a year of gymingon-and-off with my new membership, I signed up with a trainer toget serious. According to my goal to look like Christian Bale fromBatman Begins, Asad at the Castro location expertly matched mewith James Crabb. In two months: I lost ~7% body fat that I didn't know I had andgained 12 pounds of lean muscle. As someone whose weight hadnever changed after puberty, I don't have to say he'stough/inspiring/hilarious/hot to convince you he's good - he got mereal results with workouts and diet recommendations for my body. Ifeel amazing and am newly inspired to make lifting part of my newhealth routine. Progress is the best motivator. I've had trials at Equinox and other trainers at Fitness SF, butJames is a game-changer. 4/5 stars for the facilities (Mid-Marketbeing the most modern/clean) and 5/5 for my personal experienceat Fitness SF - Castro.
LayoutNode.SRC: 5/5/2017 I used to have a membership to Equinox - it was alright. I thenjoined Fitness SF - it was alright too. After a year of gymingon-and-off with my new membership, I signed up with a trainer toget serious. According to my goal to look like Christian Bale fromBatman Begins, Asad at the Castro location expertly matched mewith James Crabb.In two months: I lost ~7% body fat that I didn't know I had andgained 12 pounds of lean muscle. As someone whose weight hadnever changed after puberty, I don't have to say he'stough/inspiring/hilarious/hot to convince you he's good - he got mereal results with workouts and diet recommendations for my body. Ifeel amazing and am newly inspired to make lifting part of my newhealth routine. Progress is the best motivator.I've had trials at Equinox and other trainers at Fitness SF, butJames is a game-changer. 4/5 stars for the facilities (Mid-Marketbeing the most modern/clean) and 5/5 for my personal experienceat Fitness SF - Castro.

LayoutNode.Content: I was a member of this gym 2 years ago and left when their ratesstarted going through the roof and following an injury in their gym.They are owned by a new company who pumped a lot of moneyinto this gym and acquiring new gyms. Their ethos is disgustingand are real vampires on the community they serve with a $200sign up fee, $80 first and last month to sign up. As a returningmember they offered (in their infinite kindness) to waive mysign-up fee. I went back today after going in earlier this week to see if this wassomething I wanted to do. I work and live in the Castro and sincean injury at this gym 2 years ago I have been out of commissionand am finally ready to get back. I had all my gym clothes with meand was ready for a noon yoga class when those new signupcosts were presented to me. Earlier this week I went in and saw Patrick Keen whose businesscard says Customer Service Manager who quoted me: since I wasa former member I could get in for $69.95 per month and I wouldhave to pay first and last. I was willing to do it for a lack of otheroptions. Today I went in and a guy claiming to be a manager presented thenormal rates listed previously with the signup fee. He held thebook up between me and himself and he claimed he was themanager. The big difference was this guy had black teeth and wasdressed like he was going to a sock-hop in the 50's. As I told him about the previous visit, described the guy who gaveme lower rates, and vaguely recalled his name... I was still toldthere was nothing he could do for me. The business card for theprevious guy was at home where I found it. Considering I have always thought this industry to be prettyskeevy anyway, this did little to make me feel better about it. Iguess the tipping point is $80/month is just too much for a smalllocal gym in spite of having 5 or 6 other gyms I could use in a 5mile radius. It's disgusting and while I understand overhead andinsurance it is clear that this company is siphoning blood out ofpeople for a necessity. What should have a community interestand investment that someone is getting rich off of that and fundingcauses that go directly against the vein of the community theyserve. mercurynews.com/2012/09/… While the gym is nice and offers good classes their communityethos is pure manure. I told the guy with the black teethe that if Iwalk out I would never set foot in there again having my feelingsabout the company confirmed.

LayoutNode.Content: 5/25/2017 This review is a shout out to the awesome Jaretta and the FitnessSF Community: I brought my dad to Jaretta's Wednesday evening yoga class,listed as being for all-levels, to introduce him to yoga and get himthinking about his flexibility and mobility as he ages. I was nervoushe'd be overwhelmed but Jaretta provided him with alternativeposes for his knees and hamstrings, and she seemed seemed toadjust the pace and difficulty of the class to accommodate him. Asan experienced practitioner myself, I was nervous that classregulars would give us the stink-eye for this, but instead they weresupportive and engaged in the restorative-focused session. Mydad left the class feeling great and expressed interest in returningto learn more. This class made me proud to be a Fitness SFcommunity member. Thank you, Jaretta!
LayoutNode.SRC: 5/25/2017 This review is a shout out to the awesome Jaretta and the FitnessSF Community:I brought my dad to Jaretta's Wednesday evening yoga class,listed as being for all-levels, to introduce him to yoga and get himthinking about his flexibility and mobility as he ages. I was nervoushe'd be overwhelmed but Jaretta provided him with alternativeposes for his knees and hamstrings, and she seemed seemed toadjust the pace and difficulty of the class to accommodate him. Asan experienced practitioner myself, I was nervous that classregulars would give us the stink-eye for this, but instead they weresupportive and engaged in the restorative-focused session. Mydad left the class feeling great and expressed interest in returningto learn more. This class made me proud to be a Fitness SFcommunity member. Thank you, Jaretta!

LayoutNode.Content: The worst front desk. I went in and was greeted by someone whothinks way too highly of himself to even say hello - so I said hellofirst and asked how much a day pass costs. I got a "$30" with ahealthy dose of bitchy. I said - wow that's so expensive and hesaid "welcome to San Francisco" with a bigger dose of bitchy. Then, to make it worse an older guy who didn't even botherlooking at me said "yeah welcome to San Francisco, sweetie".WTF? I am definitely not his sweetie and when you're 40+ andworking the front desk at a gym you better check your sense ofself importance.
LayoutNode.SRC: The worst front desk.  I went in and was greeted by someone who thinks way too highly of himself to even say hello - so I said hello first and asked how much a day pass costs.  I got a "$30" with a healthy dose of bitchy.  I said - wow that's so expensive and he said "welcome to San Francisco" with a bigger dose of bitchy.  Then, to make it worse an older guy who didn't even bother looking at me said "yeah welcome to San Francisco, sweetie". WTF?  I am definitely not his sweetie and when you're 40+ and working the front desk at a gym you better check your sense of self importance.
